On March 13, I urged Pres. Trump to invoke his authority under the #DefenseProductionAct to increase the production of vital medical supplies.
 
Five days later he claimed he had.
 
Today he claimed the same.
 
President Trump, if you actually have, USE IT! We need #PPE now! https://t.co/1vhPYHrH8z

We do not have another day to waste on the Senate GOP's corporate bailout plan. This is a time to lift up and support the working people and small businesses hardest hit by the toll of this crisis and the House‚Äôs third #coronavirus response bill does just that.

3 years ago Republicans in Congress and Pres. Trump gave a multi-trillion dollar tax cut to corporations which resulted in some of the biggest stock buy backs in history + further consolidation of corporate power. We cannot use this perilous moment to make the same mistakes.

The House #coronavirus response bill prioritizes the health, wages + well-being of American workers+families. Senate Republicans are using this crisis to fast-track a bill that will further enrich corporations. We're not bailing out corporate interests w/o preconditions, period. https://t.co/tk6GbWuNsK

Remember to prioritize your mental health during this period of uncertainty:
Maine Crisis Hotline: 888-568-1112
Maine‚Äôs warm-line for non-crisis calls: 866-771-9276
Nat'l Suicide Prevention Lifeline: 800-273-8255
 
It's a sign of strength to ask for help. We're in this together.

THANK YOU to the retail workers who are courageously stocking the shelves and working the long checkout lines of our grocery stores and essential businesses during the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/vn6OmCTVyL https://t.co/EFQd88qniB

Maine small businesses already operate on thin margins & #COVID19 is making it more difficult to stay afloat. I‚Äôm proud to join @RepChrisPappas in introducing legislation that would ensure zero-interest loans, grants, and loan repayment relief through @SBAgov. https://t.co/gljVxHqXUY

Congress‚Äôs next #coronavirus aid package must provide student loan assistance by implementing an immediate moratorium on all negative credit reporting and ensure a period of debt forgiveness or loan forbearance with no additional interest accrued.

The next #COVID19 stimulus bill must maintain election integrity:
‚òëÔ∏èImplement nationwide no-excuse absentee voting
‚òëÔ∏èDedicate at least $500M to states to implement mail-in voting programs
‚òëÔ∏èProvide appropriate polling place adjustments to uphold public health

Congress‚Äôs third #COVID19 stimulus must require private health insurers, Medicare Part B, Medicare Advantage, Medicaid, CHIP, TRICARE, and the Indian Health Service to fully cover #coronavirus testing and treatment with no out-of-pocket cost.

The next #COVID19 stimulus should provide no-interest, no-fee loans + other direct assistance to small business owners + nonprofits to cover costs, including people who are self-employed. We also need loan forgiveness for businesses that retain and pay their employees.

The next #coronavirus stimulus package should implement a temporary, nationwide moratorium on evictions and foreclosures for homeowners and renters, and provide emergency rental assistance to renters directly impacted by the #COVID19 pandemic.

The next #coronavirus stimulus package must guarantee immediate cash assistance. That means targeted monthly payments that can help pay rent, buy food, and keep families afloat for the duration of this crisis.

The Senate must take up this legislation immediately. I hope the President follows through on his tweet saying he supports H.R. 6201 and will sign the House-passed bill so we can begin to ease some of the hardship caused by the #coronavirus outbreak.

I was not able to cast my vote in-person to support this critical bill because I had a long-scheduled hip surgery, which required that I return to Maine on Friday morning. I am extremely pleased to see this legislation pass on a bipartisan basis despite my absence.

Last night the House overwhelmingly approved the Families First #Coronavirus Response Act to make testing free for most patients, secure paid emergency leave, enhance unemployment insurance, strengthen food security initiatives, and increase federal Medicaid funding to states.
